intro: Parapantadenia, commonly known as the silky mistflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its soft, woolly leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Parapantadenia species are shrubs that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, with a sprawling or bushy growth habit. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by insects, contributing to its ecological importance in local habitats.
